page_title: 5 Days Lahore to Hunza Khunjerab Pass Tour Package

sections.content: Hunza Valley is one of the top tourist attraction points in Northern Areas Tour Packages. We offer Hunza Valley 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9-day trips to cover all main tourist places. The most historical place to visit in Hunza is the Baltit & Altit Fort with your local tour guide, founded in the 8th century. You can see the mountain diversity of Nagar Valley (Home of Rakaposhi – The Mother of Mist) right from Hunza Karimabad. Trip to Hunza Valley offers many tourist attractions such as Eagles Nest Hunza, Attabad Lake, and Passu Cones. We offer custom Hunza Tour packages including stays at hotels in Karimabad, Passu, and Attabad Lake. Visit the Khunjerab Pass on a day tour. Cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge, enjoy boating at Attabad, and photograph Passu Peaks. Karimabad is the capital, with sunrise views of Rakaposhi, followed by visits to Altit and Baltit forts and Eagle’s Nest.

content: Visit iconic attractions such as Attabad Lake, Karimabad, and Local Forts
Sightseeing of Rakaposhi & Nanga Parbat and Hoper Nagar Valley
Drive along the Indus River on Karakoram Highway – 8th wonder of the world
Discover Naltar Lakes (Blue and Satrangi Lake) with a Jeep ride
Witness Sunset & Sunrise at Eagle Nest with views of Golden Peak and Ultar Sar
Local guided tour to ancient Baltit & Altit Fort
Ziplining, paramotoring, and river rafting for adventure
Spend time at Karimabad Bazar and taste organic foods
Cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge with zipline
The Karakoram Highway leads to Khunjerab Pass
Stopover at Nanga Parbat, 3-mountain junction point
View Passu Peaks, Passu Glacier, and Shispar Glacier

Day_1: Departure for Hunza Naran Valley Tour
Pick up from doorstep by representative
Check in at hotel in Naran/Chillas
Day_2: Travel to Hunza from Naran Kaghan Valley
Drive to Hunza via Karakoram Highway
Day_4: Sightseeing Rakaposhi View Point & Babusar Top
Day_5: Check out & travel via Hazara Motorway

content: Boating and Jet Ski at Attabad Lake
Blazing Sunrise at Eagle Nest Duikar
Skiing at Naltar Slope in Winter
Local food taste of Glacier Breeze
Taste the Organic Fruits of Hunza

content.question: How to book the Hunza Pakistan tour?
content.answer: Pay a 40% advance via bank transfer, Easy Paisa, or Jazz Cash. Foreigners can use Remittance, Western Union, or SWIFT.

content.question: What is special about Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Known as Heaven on Earth, surrounded by peaks like Rakaposhi, Ultar Sar, Nanga Parbat, with rich culture and historic forts.

content.question: What are the hotel options in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Options include Hunza Elites, Hunza Bliss Hotel, Offto Resort, Famree Resort, Darbar Hotel, Roomy Dastan, Serena Hotel, Luxus Hunza.

content.question: What are the famous fruits of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apples, grapes, cherries, and apricots; apricot blossoms bloom in March–April, harvested in July.

content.question: What are the famous cakes of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apricot Cake at Glacier Breeze and Walnut Cake at Café De Hunza are local favorites.

content.question: What to buy from Hunza Valley?
content.answer: This information is not available in the provided text.

content.question: How to get a tourist visa to visit Hunza?
content.answer: Apply online via NADRA E-Visa or through Western Union/SWIFT; no NOC required for Gilgit-Baltistan.

content.question: What is Hunza water?
content.answer: Naturally gray-blackish water rich in silica colloids, prized for health benefits.

content.question: Is there any airport in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Flights land at Gilgit (1 hr from Islamabad), then a 3–4 hr drive to Hunza.

content.question: Which mobile networks work in Hunza?
content.answer: Telenor, Zong, and SCOM postpaid networks provide coverage.

content.question: When are the spring and autumn seasons in Hunza?
content.answer: Spring: mid-March to mid-April (blossoms); Autumn: mid-October to mid-November (fall foliage).

content.question: What are the best restaurants in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Notable spots: Café De Hunza, Rainbow Restaurant, Pizza Pamir, plus local eateries.

content.question: How many days are enough to visit Hunza?
content.answer: A 5–8 day trip allows full exploration at a comfortable pace.

content.question: Is Hunza Valley safe for tourists?
content.answer: Hunza is very safe for local and international visitors, with friendly communities and stable conditions.

content.question: What are the terms & conditions?
content.answer: Check-in 12 pm; check-out 10 am; specified meals only; park fees, tips, insurance excluded; ID required; rates vary on blackout dates; itinerary subject to change.

content: Accommodation in hotel as per the variant selected
Breakfast and dinner as mentioned in the variant
All toll tax, parking, fuel, and driver allowances
Comfortable and sanitized vehicle for sightseeing
Lunch, tea, and mineral water during travel

Extra expenses due to acts of nature or political reasons
Porter for luggage, medication, evacuation, and rescue
